attributes.action: introduce legislation preventing Islamist protest against free internet social networks.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Extreme ideological Islam threatens to undermine some basic western values; notably our freedom of speech.
Internet based social netwroks have allowed peple to express themselves intenationally, free of censorship and regulation, at the touch of a button like never before.
Islamist groups have sought to march against this, and campaign for such websites as Facebook, Twitter and YouTube to be 'morally regulated' and dragged down by compulsory user fees.
It is important that parliament shows solidarity in its constitutional loyalty to the right of free speech, and bans these absurd and temeritous attacks on our basic civil values.

reasons: Language which is offensive, intemperate, or provocative
